description: System-generated unique identifier for the project record.
User-facing project code or short name used to identify and group work; may be alphanumeric. Likely not strictly unique across time; confirm with SME.
Free-text explanation of the project’s purpose, scope, or details.
Status of the project as a coded value referencing a status lookup (e.g., planned, active, closed); confirm reference table.
General ledger account or cost center to which project costs are posted; likely GL code used for accounting; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the supervisor responsible for the project; references an employee or user record.
Planned start date/time for the project.
Date/time when work on the project actually began.
Planned completion date/time for the project.
Date/time when the project was actually completed or closed.
Planned labor effort in hours for all staff on the project.
Planned labor cost for the project, in the system’s base currency.
Planned cost of parts and materials required for the project.
Planned miscellaneous or non-labor, non-parts costs for the project.
Projected asset downtime in hours due to this project’s work (vehicles/equipment unavailable).
System timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Timestamp recorded from the user/client context for the last change; may duplicate system timestamp; confirm semantics.
Identifier of the user who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified the record.
Timestamp when a user last modified the record (audit trail).
